summary: While scientific discoveries can be serendipitous, reliable research is more often built on successive studies that employ rigorous design, documentation, and confirmation. The U.S. government funded over $42 billion in science research in 2019. How can federal agencies help assure the reliability of that research? Experts and others have suggested that agencies implement practices such as disclosing results and methods earlier, as well as incentivizing...
title: Research Reliability: Federal Actions Needed to Promote Stronger Research Practices
